lines.text: Frank do you love me?
YOU STILL NEED REASSURANCE, AFTER 45 YEARS OF BONDAGE?
[repeated line]
Holy crap!
Ok, you know what? I'm tired of this. I'd rather be normal than this.
[imitates Marie]
Ooh, dear how are you. Frosting in a can, so much easier than homemade. Look in that refrigerator. Whoa, smells like there wasn't anything good in here for a while.
[imitates Frank]
Time for desert. Holy crap. I'm not listening anymore, doo dah, doo dah...
[imitates Robert]
Oh, everything's turning out perfect for Raymond.
[increasingly frustrated]
Oh, lucky Raymond. Everybody loves Raymond. EVERYBODY loves Raymond. EVERYBODY LOVES Raymond. EVERYBODY LOVES RAYMOND!
[everybody laughs]
Do me, now.

[after seeing Ray and Robert hug each other]
Your sons are hugging.
I'll get the hose.
[about Debra's dad's new girlfriend]
Well, usually guys his age go for younger women. Instead of going for somebody younger he went for somebody different.
Ray!
I meant... No! I mean, I always say the opposite phrases of what I say. Like, just this morning I told Debra "I'm soup, can I get some hungry?"
[laughs nervously]
[Debra's mom leaves, Debra looks at Ray menacingly and goes after her mother]
Oh, man...
Kill is going to Debra you.
[Frank is eating lasagna from the platter]
Frank! What are you doing? You can't eat it from there! Your fork was in there! Now nobody can eat it!
That's all I have to do? In that case, the fork's been in the ice cream, too!

[comes in]
Hey.
Hi, Raymond. Are you hungry? Do you want something to eat? Only you can't have lasagna... Or ice cream.

[sticks his fork in cake]
Or chocolate cake.
Look at him! He's like an animal, marking his territory!
[Frank sticks Marie with the fork]
Hey!
What? That's a compliment.
God, how I wish I could say this is the wrong house...
[Robert started hanging out with black people]
I don't even understand one word you're saying anymore. Yesterday, why the hell did you call me "dog"?
It's a good thing. It means I like you.
I see. In that case, from this day on I'm calling you "jackass". That's also a sign of affection.
[Ray comes in]
Hey, ugly.
What the hell was that for?
It's "Robert Talk". It means you're good-looking.
[to Marie]
Hey, good-looking.
Who keeps pornography for twenty-nine years?
Anyone married to you.
Whatever helps you sleep at night, Peaches.
Honey, show daddy what you drew.
That's okay, I can figure it out.
[Ally hands Ray a drawing]
Um, lets see. A big wall of red?
No.
Ally told me that was a picture of you in hell.
What in the holy name of crap are you talking about?
You know, Robert gets the jealousy thing from me.
Oh, yeah?
Yeah, one time I drove my fist through a Cadillac, on account of your mother.
Really?

Yeah. She started talking about marriage, and I told her to go to hell. I remember hearing through the grapevine, that your mother was going to have dinner at Chuck Pacarello's. Now, your mother's cooking, that's something... special. And, I figured, she was only gonna cook like that for me. So, I went to Chuck Pacarello's and punched the headlights off of his car. I spent the night in the hospital, picking glass out of my arm.
Wow, dad, I never thought there was a story like that behind you and mom. It's almost romantic.
Yeah, I know. I don't tell that story a lot, though.
How come?
Because it doesn't have a happy ending.

Ok, Robert, you want to know the advantages of marriage? Fine... There's... Uh... OK! Here! Got it! You know when you fall asleep and you stop breathing? When you're married, there's always somebody there to nudge you back to life... That's not a good example. Ok...
Ray...

No! I got this! Look, you want to know what marriage is really like? Fine. You wake up- she's there. You come back from work- she's there. You fall asleep- she's there. You eat dinner- she's there. You know? I mean, I know that sounds like a bad thing. But, it's not.
[touches Debra's shoulder]
Not- Not if it's the right person.
[pause]
I'd like a minute for rebuttal.
I'm a freak!
You're superfreaky!
Nothing is ever good enough, and it's always our fault!
Hey, you can't speak to your mother like that!
You do!
She's not my mother!
This coming from the guy who once threw his shoe at a swan.
It's called protecting your sandwich!

[after walking in on Robert flashing Ray]
I remember it from the tub.
Chuck Pacarello? Where the hell is he? That son of a bitch owes me. I'm serving his life sentence!

[to Ray]
You're even dumber than I tell people.
What's for brunch, Marie?
Ham.
Excellent. I shall put on my ham pants.
You said you didn't know me?
You were stuffing your pants with food!
So? I'm your husband, you're supposed to love me no matter what's in my pants!
Maybe that's why I like animals. Woof. Moo. Quack. They tell it like it is.
I actually say a prayer that Ray doesn't do so good that day.
You say a prayer?
Come on, God, get him!

[to Robert]
It's your life. You do what you want to do.
Until you're married... then you do what SHE wants you to do.
I'm sorry the check got stuck to the chubby hubby.
Oh Frank. You've never said that to me before.
No one's ever said that before.
[repeated line]
Are ya hungry dear?
[after the twins have knocked his golf clubs down the stairs]
Yeah... you won't be smiling when we send you a postcard from Disneyland.
I wish I were Einstein cause then I'd invent a time machine and go back to when you were nice.
You know what, I'm tired! Could you just call yourself an idiot?
I'm a cop and live with my parents. I'm on a constant diet of human suffering.
You're giving him back that money!
Like hell, I am! I want to teach him a lesson. You up the stakes, you lose a lot. You play with matches and you get burned.
[sticks check in front of Raymond]
AND, THANK YOU, COME AGAIN!
Shouldn't you be yelling at me, or something?
Ray, when you're on the Titanic you lower the lifeboats. You don't stop to yell at the iceberg.
[Ray has hurt his back and is in bed with Debra]
I guess I am going to be out of commission for a while.
I wouldn't worry - it's not like Van Gogh has lost his paint brush.
[after Raymond sees Deborah crying all alone]
Do you cry because I'm stupid?
No, I eat ice cream because you are stupid.
How about I hit you with your own wife?
All I wanted was a place where people would care about me.
You have that here, you stupid ass!
[Ray just ended a sentence with "at"; Marie is infuriated]

This is the end of civilization! People like you don't wanna learn or do anything, because they're too busy with their remote control televisions, or playing with their hula hoops, and before you know it,
[shouts]
that's where we're at!
Where the cookies at?
It's nice to be important. But it's more important... to be nice.
So, Debra's parents are coming over?
Yeah, they don't come around much anymore, so we want to spend as much time as possible with them.
[Robert stares at him, not buying it]
I've been told that's how I feel.
[repeated line]
Is this about me?
[Frank is dressed as Frankenstein, growling copiously at Marie]
You think that's any different from what you really sound?
[Ray is bunking with Robert]
Could you, er, put a shirt on?
[gets under the covers]
And some underpants?
Excuse me! I believe this is MY bed.
Yeah, I know. But when you get in bed with a guy, you... put some pants on!
[repeated line]
I don't like that.
[Ray is trying to seem manly to a friend]

[to Debra]
Let's try and get it spot free. This isn't like at home where I let that stuff slide.
You can't create fate cause then its not fate, its voodoo.
He hates it when I cry. It reminds him of our wedding night.
'Luck' is the residue of good planning.

[after talking to his parents]
You know, it's amazing I can function at all.
Never be afraid to pull the trigger, on your smile.
Where did you just come from?
I went to the bathroom.
No, you didn't.
I'm doing it right now.
Hence all the hullabaloo.
